result.execSummary:
The defendant Owen G. Cloud Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UAs.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Owen G. Cloud in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Parties rec/rev PSI.  No corrections to be made.  State makes recommendations.  Atty Masana makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of voting rights, felony firearm warnings and voting rights.

$1474.00 fine/costs/surcharges and $25.00 blood draw fees to be paid during term of probation per agent (cash bond to be applied)
Revoke DL 36 months
IID for 36 months effective upon licensure
AODA
Conditions of probation:
10 months jail w/huber privileges and release for treatment to commence forthwith
113 days jail credit to be applied ONLY if probation is revoked
DNA sample to be provided
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances
Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol w/the exception of Ho-Chunk for employment purposes only
Seek/maintain full-time employment/education
Treatment/counseling per agent
Not to operate MV w/o valid DL
Ct 3:

Costs of $443.00 to be paid per agent during term of probation
Conditions the same as in Ct 1

Sentencing hearing on April 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Owen G. Cloud in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Owen G. Cloud in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea entered on Ct. 1 , dismiss but read in Cts. 2 & 3, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court orders PSI and free to argue sentencing.  Report to be back to the court by April 10th.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing on February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Return date on February 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Owen G. Cloud appeared by video means with Attorney Sacra. Prosecuting Atty Kevin R. Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request small cash bond.  Gives criminal history.  No warrant history.  Attorney Sacra request $100.00 cash bond.  Defendant should qualify.  Time limits waived.  $250.00 CASH bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
